result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence and count two. Huber privileges for work and treatment. Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and surcharges within term of probation or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Dennis B. or 4136 W. Fond Du Lac Ave, Milwaukee, WI.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
**Parties stiplate to and Court orderd DNA sample waived because defendant already has a DNA sample on file.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results. Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
(x) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  02-05-2015       Initials:  sm

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  COUNTS 1 AND 2:    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $0 (ZERO).  
COUNT 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence and count 2, with credit for 3
days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Perform 25 hours of community service.
*No contact with Dennis B. or 4136 W. Fond du Lac Ave., Milwaukee, WI.
* Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
***Parties stipulate to and court ordered DNA sample WAIVED because defendant already has a DNA sample on file.

COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve
 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence and count 1, with credit for 3 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of  18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Perform 25 hours of community service.
*No contact with Dennis B. or 4136 W. Fond du Lac Ave., Milwaukee, WI.
* Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
***Parties stipulate to and court ordered DNA sample WAIVED because defendant already has a DNA sample on file.


Counts 1 and 2:  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court. Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor appeared telephonically. Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense out of town and requesting an adjournment. Case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Court vacates 8-13-2014 jury trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed charging: COUNT 1: CRIMINAL TRESPASS TO DWELLING, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.14, 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor, and COUNT 2:  THEFT (VALUE NOT EXCEEDING $2,500) - AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) & (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05, a Class A Misdemeanor.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  James C Griffin for Ytrone St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties are notified that effective August 4, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Randy Sitzberger for Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-17-2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dennis B. or his residence or place of employment and the address 4136 W. FDL Ave.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Deshireo Tyveonce Rivers not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/14 @ 1:30pm
